title: Kopke 1965 Special Edition Tawny  (Port)
description: From a year in which only single quinta vintage Ports were produced, this is a hugely concentrated toffee and dried fruit wine. It is rich with sweetness and a dense texture that is balancing complex flavors against the drier wood-aging flavors. It has been bottled just at the right stage of its development, rich and dense. Drink this beautiful wine now.

title: Croix de Beaucaillou 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Velvet tannins are allied with powerful fruit to create a rich wine with signs of the wood aging that smooth it further. It will be a generous wine that will keep its fine fruitiness for many years.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2012 Herdade de São Miguel Private Collection Red (Alentejano)
description: A small, selected production of 2000 bottles has produced a dark and dense wine that is still so young. Powered by ripe tannins and equally ripe plum skins, this is a powerful wine with an elegant background. Juicy acidity is still fresh, lifting the fruit and giving a surprisingly fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Private Collection

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2009 Osterberg Grand Cru Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)
description: Stone, earth and hay are about to merge into notions of lanolin and chamomile: clearly this is a maturing wine at an early point of its evolution. The palate is fluid and has the texture of drenched chalky, stone. The fruit is hiding in the wings, only to appear as orange oil here or as apple scent there. The dryness shows every nuance of this earthy, wine from a historic, co-planed vineyard of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Gewurztraminer. What a triumph. Drink 2016–2026.
designation: Osterberg Grand Cru Clos du Zahnacker

title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2007 Hengst Grand Cru Sélection de Grains Nobles Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: A wealth of notions hits the palate: baked apple, fir honey, lemon-scented caramel and burnt sugar. The palate does not hold back, either, and lets all these notions dance in swirls of dizzying richness. Caramel-crusted apricots glow in the background while everything is lit up with bright, fresh acidity, highlighting apricot, apple and honey.
designation: Hengst Grand Cru Sélection de Grains Nobles

title: Château Cantenac Brown 2015 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich and opulent, with dense tannins and a smooth texture. Blackberry fruit flavors are coupled with ample acidity to balance the wine's ripeness.

title: Château Dassault 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a beautifully structured wine. Acidity and spice mingle with rich black-currant fruits. It is concentrated, with a fine stream of fresh acidity cutting through it. At this point, the wine's weight and freshness are melding well.

title: Château Duhart-Milon 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. There are plenty of firm tannins here, although this wine succeeds because of the intense acidity and classic black currant flavors. It is already a delicious wine with its fine acidity and lively aftertaste.

title: Château Grand Mayne 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is balanced, with fragrant berry fruits and new wood flavors. Treading a fine line between richness and elegance, it has spice and rich toast flavors as well as bright acidity.

title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Luscious while still showing great balance, this is a fine wine. It has ripe orange and lemon flavors that are never too sweet. Acidity cuts through the texture, lifting the wine and giving it a brilliant, elegant aftertaste.

title: Château Latour 2015 Les Forts de Latour Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. There is a velvet touch to this smooth, rounded wine. With some dark tannins as well as blackberry fruits, it is rich with some concentration. At the same time, the acidity shoots through the wine to give a really fruity aftertaste.
designation: Les Forts de Latour Barrel Sample

title: Château Margaux 2015 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. With a high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a seriously structured wine. It is ripe with a shot of fine acidity and tannins that give the wine great shape and freshness. The structure is what will give this wine its longevity.
designation: Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux Barrel Sample

title: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2013 Red (Swartland)
description: A blend of 68% Shiraz, 18% Grenache, 10% Cinsault and 4% Tinta Barocca, this is one of the finest reds coming out of South Africa today. It is powerful and concentrated, yet elegant and refined, with notes of lush red cherry, raspberry and plum that are complemented by notes of game, pepper and fynbos. Fine yet gripping tannins and tight fruit flavors lend a solid structure to the rich mouthfeel, while notes of peppered berries and mentholated herbs linger long on the finish. Drink 2020–2025.

title: Angove 2012 The Medhyk Old Vine Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: A tip of the cap to the Angove family for turning out such an ageworthy wine. It's packed and stacked with mulberry fruit, lashings of vanilla and just a hint of mint. Full-bodied and tannic, it should drink well from 2020–2030.

title: Ayoub 2012 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Bright cherry fruit expands in the glass, with a hard-candy character, juicy acids, and polished tannins. It's forward, as per the vintage, but structured for further development. Pretty spices and a lick of caramel come up in the finish. Drink now through 2025.

title: Big Basin 2013 Coastview Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Light and a little cloudy in the glass, this is a delicious and deep wine from a vineyard in the eastern Salinas Valley, with lime blossoms, squeezed lemons, wet cement and salted white peach on the nose. The palate deftly pairs chalk, sour cream, and lime zest with dried white peach, sea salt and fresh churned butter.

title: Boeckel 2013 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Soft, gentle fruit of stewed apple shimmers on the nose but on the palate is contained by immense, lemony zestiness. There is real muscle and elegance. The body is dry, slender but concentrated and beautifully clean with inflections of stone. This is a beacon of clarity and clean fruit, shining with a pristine, citrus-kissed purity. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2013 Beyra Superior Red (Beira Interior)
description: A field blend of grapes from old vines plus a year in wood have given this wine both structure and concentration. Dark fruits, firm tannins and acidity are all present in this complex, age-worthy wine. It comes from vineyards just south of the Douro, grown on granite soils at a height of 2,100 feet. It's a serious wine that needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Luis Cañas 2009 Reserva Selección de la Familia  (Rioja)
description: Smoky, toasty oak aromas are dominant on a black-fruit bouquet that also shows graphite. This is saturated and tight, with complexity and outright deliciousness of savory, meaty, spicy blackberry flavors. Toast, cured beef and cocoa flavors prove that there's more to this than just heft and oak. Best from 2019 through 2032.

title: Quinta da Foz 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Situated at the mouth of the Pinhão River in the heart of the Douro vineyards, the steep slopes of this quinta are a prominent landmark. The wine is dark and dense, made to age with its firm tannins and concentrated black fruit flavors. Structured and still very firm, it will age well. Drink from 2018.

title: Pintia 2010 Pintia  (Toro)
description: Gritty, charred aromas rest on top of core blackberry and cassis scents. This is a blocky, stout number with firm tannins and serious structure. Charred blackberry and dark chocolate are the lead flavors, while this big-boned Toro tastes of toast and mocha on the finish, which is drying and tannic. Drink through 2027.

title: Élevée Winegrowers 2013 Élevée Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Sourced from a vineyard planted by Gary Andrus in 1998, this elegant and expressive wine is shaded a lovely rose tone, and scents of rose petals and ripe cherries emerge instantly from the glass. It's well defined, balanced and detailed with sandalwood, cocoa powder, cinnamon and orange-liqueur highlights. Drink now through 2021.

title: Liberalia 2007 Liber Gran Reserva  (Toro)
description: Mature, ripe aromas of raisin, caramel, tobacco and fine oak form a pleasing, inviting bouquet. Drawing, edgy and still quite tannic in feel, this tastes rooty, baked and lightly stewed, with just enough berry and plum fruit to prop things up. On the finish, chocolate, prune and baked notes of pastry and cake are potent and delicious. Drink through 2027.

title: Domaine Laporte 2012 La Vigne de Beaussoppet  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Produced from a single parcel, whose origins go back to 1492, this fresh, herbal and crisp wine is fruity and complex at the same time. Intense acidity is allied with pineapple and apricot flavors. The elegant mineral texture cuts through the fruitiness, giving a fine structure. The wine is now ready to drink.

title: Domaines Schlumberger 2011 Spiegel Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Utterly glowing notes of pear already point towards richness. Notes of smoke and nuttiness prevent them from appearing facile. The palate rings with the same fruity glow and introduces soft, pliable sweetness. Earthy elements echo here and there from the concentrated, focused palate. This certainly leaves a mark and finishes almost dry.

title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Graacher Himmelreich Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Whiffs of Assam tea and honey permeate throughout this bright, bristling spätlese accenting succulent yellow peach and tangerine flavors. It's vibrant and brisk, but finishes on a sweet, meandering marmalade kiss. Stunning already but structured enough to evolve beautifully through at least 2025.

title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a boldly expressive testament to the vineyard site from which it comes. A concentrated and lushly textured wine, it exudes lime and a hit of tropical papaya buoyed as it goes by bristling acidity and a hint of wild vanilla. Indicative of a ripe, warm vintage, it remains balanced and deliciously exuberant from start to finish.

title: Adelsheim 2013 Bryan Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Young and tight, this is packed with bright berry fruit annotated with brown spices. There are streaks of sandalwood and mocha, and the flavors smooth out nicely as it glides into a lingering, delicious finish.

title: Adelsheim 2013 Ribbon Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Among the impressive single-vineyard Adelsheim Pinots, this is the only one from this tiny AVA. It's loaded with bright, sparky cranberry and raspberry fruit, whose juicy flavors hit the palate's bullseye. The penetrating power is underscored with minerally acidity. Drink now through 2030.

title: Alloro 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Initially this may strike some tasters as an unusual expression, but give it a chance and it may well become a favorite. There's an interesting component of crushed flowers in aroma and flavor, along with nut oil, butterscotch, pineapple and apple butter. It's all supported by a mineral-driven vein.
